clinical_study.brief_title: Development of a Computer-aided Polypectomy Decision Support
clinical_study.official_title: Development of a Computer-aided Polypectomy Decision Support

lead_sponsor.agency: Centre hospitalier de l'Université de Montréal (CHUM)

clinical_study.source: Centre hospitalier de l'Université de Montréal (CHUM)

brief_summary.textblock: Quality components of colonoscopy include the detection and complete removal of colorectal polyps, which are precursors to CRC. However, endoscopic ablation may be incomplete, posing a risk for the development of "interval cancers". The investigator propose to develop a solution based on artificial intelligence (AI) (CADp computer-aided decision support polypectomy) to solve this problem.This research project aims to develop CADp, a computer decision support solution (CDS) for the ablation of colorectal polyps from 1 to 20 mm.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: prospective, multi-endoscopist, single center, clinical study at tertiary referral center (CHUM)

primary_outcome.description: accuracy with which the CADp system predicts completeness of polypectomy in the test set with the reference standard for completeness being determined by the histology of post-polypectomy margin biopsies; if free from any polyp tissue (adenomatous, serrated or hyperplastic), the resection will be considered complete. If remnant polyp tissue is detected in any one or more of the margin biopsies the resection is deemed incomplete

We will evaluate the agreement between the different subjective and objective ways of assessing the completeness of the polypectomy : evaluation of margins (presence or not, measurement of margins) by endoscopists self-assessment, and by expert consensus.

Evaluation of the concordance of data on polyp size, extension of margins around the polyp, quality of resection between clinical data (endoscopists' self-assessment and experts' assessments) and CADp prediction.

primary_outcome.measure: Validity of the choice of primary outcome
primary_outcome.description: Based on the results and comparison of the different assessment methods, we will perform sensitivity analyses to assess the validity and robustness of the choice of primary outcome.

arm_group.arm_group_label: Artificial intelligence for real-time Computer decision support of resection of colorectal polyps
arm_group.description: A standard colonoscopy will be performed according to the standard of routine care. All optically diagnosed polyps will be removed and sent to the CHUM pathology laboratory for histopathological evaluation according to institutional standards. The AI system will capture video of the procedure in real time, and provide additional information about polypectomy procedures.

intervention.intervention_name: Computer-aided polypectomy decision support by Artificial Intelligence
intervention.description: The AI system will capture the live video of the procedure and the AI feedbackwill be shown on a second screen installed next to the regular endoscopy screen. Screen A will show the regular endoscopy image and screen B will show the regular endoscopy image together with the areas that might harbor a polyp and the information to help the polypectomy.
intervention.arm_group_label: Artificial intelligence for real-time Computer decision support of resection of colorectal polyps

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Signed informed consent
- Age 45-80 years
- Indication to undergo a lower GI endoscopy.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Known inflammatory bowel disease
- Active colitis
- Coagulopathy
- Familial polyposis syndrome;
- Poor general health, defined as an American Society of Anesthesiologists (ASA) physical status class >3
- Emergency colonoscopies
